content: I made a rough sketch of what I think the filters should look like. Thoughts? Screenshot-2022-04-20-at-12.16.04-PM.png Screenshot-2022-04-20-at-12.20.59-PM.png
The check-circle is to enable/disable filter. cross-circle is to clear filters.
There is no clear all filters, instead I added a disable current filters which I think is more useful.
Using dropdown widgets or muti-dropdown widges is not an option here. It will be much faster to do this from scratch.
sound goods
Hmm, I think I'd prefer having separate inputs for "Filter streams" vs the other controls (unread, participated, etc.)
The other UI detail is I think it'd be valuable for it to be visible without clicking what filters are currently selected.

One approach is a combination of checkboxes in a stream selector dropdown with showing pills for what's currently selected:

Screen-Shot-2022-04-20-at-4.00.53-PM.png

Something like this should work well in that case. We don't have that many filters for us to require showing pills in a separate line (even if it looks cooler).
Screenshot-2022-04-21-at-11.26.37-AM.png

I don't think the pills are strictly required, but they would address Tim Abbott 's comment above:

The other UI detail is I think it'd be valuable for it to be visible without clicking what filters are currently selected.

Screenshot-2022-04-21-at-12.44.16-PM.png
Ok, how about this?
Before I start designing this. DO we want to make that section complicated control center or simple which covers 80% of needs with 20% of UI complexity?

Thanks for mocking that up Aman Agrawal (amanagr) !

To Vlad Korobov 's question, I think that's a great thing to ask, and merits a deeper discussion.

What are the ways folks are using the recent topics page? A few I'm aware of are:

  1. Participants in busy communities who don't need to read every topic use it to find ones they are interested in. This one comes up a lot in user interviews.
1. People who do read everything use it as sort of inbox view (probably with the "Unread" filter?).

1. I personally use it mostly to check if people have replied to messages I sent recently, i.e. Unread & Participated checked. (cf. #6605)

Because we don't have the "unmute topic" feature yet, it's probably the best way to see if someone responded to you in a muted stream by checking the "Include muted" box in addition to the two above, though I'm not sure that occurred to me until now; I don't think it's easy to discover.

One thing I worry about is that if we make the page look too much like an advanced search page, people will use it as such. At least as currently implemented, this is problematic, because only recent topics are included. But I don't think users necessarily have that "everything older is absent from this page" fact as part of their mental model. It would be hard for them to, as there's no user-comprehensible rule for exactly how much history is there.
Please share your stories of how you use/think about Recent topics. :)
Reading through #6605 reminds me -- are we envisioning that Recent topics will also be the place to look at followed/subscribed topics someday (#4271)?
By the way, I found it interesting to skim the thread where the design was originally discussed, #frontend > #6605 (Recent Topics) .

Alya Abbott said:

Reading through #6605 reminds me -- are we envisioning that Recent topics will also be the place to look at followed/subscribed topics someday (#4271)?

I expect we'll support searching for such topics directly, but that we'll also enable viewing them in "Recent topics".
filter by user

@Andrea Soc just to be clear, is what you have in mind being able to filter by whether a particular other user is a participant (whether a private message or stream conversation)? Can you talk about your use case a bit?
For example search a word in specific stream by specific user
@Andrea Soc ahh, you can already do that with https://zulip.com/help/search-for-messages.

Vlad Korobov said:

Before I start designing this. DO we want to make that section complicated control center or simple which covers 80% of needs with 20% of UI complexity?

We should go with something super simple so that more users instantly know how this works.

I personally use it mostly to check if people have replied to messages I sent recently, i.e. Unread & Participated checked.

Me too.

Hey, while I'm designing that part could somebody tell me if we are able (do we want?) to show user status in the Recent Topics?
Here is the illustration of the difference image.png

Good question! I would worry a bit about the combination of line-wrapping and the fact that status could both be status emoji and the availability circle making it feel pretty cluttered. (Certainly it feels like it'd be a bit ugly if the name and icons ended up on different lines)
From a data perspective, we can of course display it if useful; so it's mostly a visual/utility question.

Ok, so can display the status of every user. I think in the recent topics it does matter to see who is online...
I don't worry about status and emoji since they could be connected with non-breaking space?
Yeah, that sounds right for the line-wrapping issue. I could imagine the information being useful, certainly, so showing both seems good if it won't make the view look overly busy, which is a risk.
